content.description: short dynamic route up the nose like feature on the far right side of the lower boulder.
content.location: far right side of the lower boulder

content.description: Now bolted and a great little route. Shares the same anchor as Taintasoreass.
The short bolted face to the right of Dinosaur Balls makes for a fine warm up.
content.location: to the right of Dinosaur Balls

content.description: Start on the face just right of the huge overhang. Moderate terrain leads to some awkward moves through  the super steep bulge.
content.location: to the right of Drew's Route

content.description: Begin on the ramp to the right of Sunshine Amnesia. An awkward start and then easier climbing to a stance below the steep, sloping, and sharp traverse that finally finishes through the roof to the top of the boulder.
content.location: to the right of Sunshine Amnesia

content.description: moderate climbing to a stout roof move with a very painful jam. Tape up the fingers for this one. Its worthy of some serious attempts but climbers have fallen short of a red-point so far (2016)
content.location: to the right of Slice Of Life

content.description: start in the cave at the beginning of the rail, make a few big reaches to get to the easier start.
content.protection: a pad would be nice for the start as your right above a few rocks
content.location: back entrance of the cave on the lower boulder.

content.description: Start with the left hand pinch and right hand side-pull. Traverse left past the rail and reach up over the lip for a jug, top out here.
content.protection: A single pad would be nice.
content.location: Start at the back entrance of the cave on the lower boulder, next to the trees leaning against the rock.

content.description: Just right of the chasm. Great roof finish. Sketchy (reach) clip at the fourth or fifth bolt, canâ€™t remember which
content.location: just right of Open Wide, on the lower boulder

climbs.name: Open Wide
climbs.fa: B. Workman, Chelsea H., T. Nelson

content.description: Stem and bridge easily up the chasm and then head left up the more difficult face.
The more difficult finish for Slice Of Life opting for a direct exit rather than continuing left. Challenging but not as good as the original finish. Still awaits a red-point.
content.location: Slice Of Life with an early and more strenuous exit

content.description: A fun and short little tyrant. Tough start to a short flake.

A surprisingly strenuous and involved pitch for its length. Bust a 5.9 mantle move off the deck to reach the first bolt. The Crux comes immediately after and involves thin, reachy, beaking with ground fall potential, heads up. Post crux, the climbing becomes safer but still strenuous. Watch for loose blocks near the end of the crack. Make a disgusting free move through moss and mud to surmount the overhang. anchor is the large cedar 25 ft up and right, don't slip. Or walk off past the tree.
content.protection:
3-4 #1 left cant tomahawks (crucial)

1 #2 straight tomahawk

1 each KB #1 #2 #3

1 each LA #1 #2

1 each lowe balls #1 #2

1 fixed brassie #3

2 bolts (placed by Ian G. before FA)

Tree anchor or walk off.
content.location: The hairline crack running through the steepest part of the roof on the upper formation, climber's left, two bolts mark the start.

content.description: A short and sturdy problem with the main difficulties near the start. Tends to drool for a little while but once it dries out its a worthy opponent.
content.location: far left side of the upper boulder

content.description: Around the right side of the upper boulder is this short but fun crack climb. Start in the wide crack and traverse right to the a ledge and then the short corner crack above utilizing face holds more so than the crack.
content.location: around the right side of the upper boulder.

content.description: An extension to bumbershoot which links it with the top of slice of life. Climb bumbershoot and clip one of the chains (or don't) and continue right towards a bolt. After the bolt a few moves bring you to the jug below the final lip on slice of life. While I only added one bolt and a handful of moves, I believe this link-up makes for the best climb at the crag, hosting a very interesting crux and a more logical finish to bumbershoot.
content.protection: Bolts, a long sling is nice for below the final lip
content.location: Up and right from the chains on bumbershoot.

content.description: A tricky start then a bit of stemming to a stance. Head left up the featured face to a tough mantle move followed by the crux finish to the first set of anchors. One could continue through the roof to the top making it slightly harder.

Rail, flake and edge up moderate terrain to a nice stance on a ledge below the beginning of the business. A couple moves up an awkward corner to an under-cling flake beneath an overhang. Traverse right to a big sharp hold and then continue up the technical face. A difficult clip at the anchor makes for an abrupt finish to an otherwise flowing route. Still this is a fun climb that stays dry during pretty wet conditions. A continuation could be done to the top of the boulder and would likely be 5.13.
content.location: to the right of Slip Of The Tip

content.description: Tricky and balancy. 10+ if you stem across the chasm 11- if you don't. Spicy fall potential.
content.location: to the right of Little Napoleon and just left of the deep chasm on the lower boulder.

pathTokens: Hwy 20 and North Cascades National Park
Walker Valley and Lake Cavanaugh Rd Crags
